title: What is wrong in this English sentence, 'Here and their, lay the dismembered parts of the soldiers' bodies'? - Quora

response.answer_text: A minor detail needs fixing: turning their to there because their = of them, but the adverb there points to direction, which is what the sentence needs. Secondly, one needs to do away with the intervening comma after there. Here and there is very crucial to the sense in the sentence. It needn’t be made parenthetical with a comma, inviting an unneeded pause. corrected sentence: “Here and there lay the dismembered parts of the soldiers’ bodies”. Linguistica7
